title: Drawing, "Drawing Room", ca. 1842
medium: Brush and watercolor, white gouache on white paper
provenance: Eugene V. Thaw Collection; William Drummond, London
dimensions:
Old frame H x W x D: 40.6 x 45.7 x 2.7 cm (16  x 18  x 1 1/8 in.)
Sheet: 20.5 x 27.1 cm (8 1/16 x 10 11/16 in.)
description: This drawing room, typical of the early Victorian period, shows the intimate comfort of a well lived-in room.  The ladies of the house are about their pursuits; the gentleman attends his dog.  Pictures line the walls, and a piano, a large round center table, a vase of flowers, a bird in its cage, a curious stuffed leopard, and shelves of books create an atmosphere of quiet relaxation. Books hanging on the door of the room are a seldom-depicted feature.

exhibitions.title: House Proud: 19th Century Watercolor Interiors from the Thaw Collection

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Drawing Room", ca. 1842.
ca. 1842. Brush and watercolor, white gouache on white paper. Thaw Collection. 2007-27-35.
